externalDocs.description: Official Cloud Foundry API Spec Site

get.summary: List all App Usage Events
get.description:
Events are sorted by internal database IDs.
This order may differ from created_at.
Events close to the current time should not be processed because other events may still have open transactions that will change their order in the results.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page of results to fetch

parameters.name: results-per-page
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: order-direction
parameters.description: Order of the results: asc (default) or desc

parameters.name: after_guid
parameters.description: Restrict results to App Usage Events after the one with the given guid

post.summary: Purge and reseed App Usage Events
post.description:
Destroys all existing events.
Populates new usage events, one for each started app.
All populated events will have a created_at value of current time.
There is the potential race condition if apps are currently being started, stopped, or scaled.
The seeded usage events will have the same guid as the app.

get.summary: Retrieve a Particular App Usage Event

put.summary: Associate Route with the App

delete.summary: Remove Route from the App

post.summary: Copy the app bits for an App
post.description:
This endpoint will copy the package bits in the blobstore from the source app to the destination app.
It will always return a job which you can query for success or failure.
This operation will require the app to restart in order for the changes to take effect.

source_app_guid.description: The guid for the source app

name.description: The name of the app.

memory.description: The amount of memory each instance should have. In megabytes.

instances.description: The number of instances of the app to run. To ensure optimal availability, ensure there are at least 2 instances.

disk_quota.description: The maximum amount of disk available to an instance of an app. In megabytes.

space_guid.description: The guid of the associated space.

stack_guid.description: The guid of the associated stack.

state.description: The current desired state of the app. One of STOPPED or STARTED.

command.description: The command to start an app after it is staged, maximum length: 4096 (e.g. 'rails s -p $PORT' or 'java com.org.Server $PORT').

buildpack.description: Buildpack to build the app. 3 options: a) Blank means autodetection; b) A Git Url pointing to a buildpack; c) Name of an installed buildpack.

health_check_http_endpoint.description: Endpoint called to determine if the app is healthy.

health_check_type.description: Type of health check to perform. 'none' is deprecated and an alias to 'process'.

health_check_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for health checking of an staged app when starting up

diego.description: Use diego to stage and to run when available

enable_ssh.description: Enable SSHing into the app. Supported for Diego only.

docker_image.description: Name of the Docker image containing the app. The "diego_docker" feature flag must be enabled in order to create Docker image apps.

docker_credentials.description: Docker credentials for pulling docker image.

environment_json.description: Key/value pairs of all the environment variables to run in your app. Does not include any system or service variables.

console.description: Open the console port for the app (at $CONSOLE_PORT).

debug.description: Open the debug port for the app (at $DEBUG_PORT).

staging_failed_description.example: An app was not successfully detected by any available buildpack

ports.description: Ports on which application may listen. Overwrites previously configured ports. Ports must be in range 1024-65535. Supported for Diego only.

get.summary: Downloads the bits for an App
get.description:
When using a remote blobstore, such as AWS, the response is a redirect to the actual location of the bits.
If the client is automatically following redirects, then the OAuth token that was used to communicate with Cloud Controller will be replayed on the new redirect request.
Some blobstores may reject the request in that case.
Clients may need to follow the redirect without including the OAuth token.

get.summary: Downloads the staged droplet for an App
get.description:
When using a remote blobstore, such as AWS, the response is a redirect to the actual location of the bits.
If the client is automatically following redirects, then the OAuth token that was used to communicate with Cloud Controller will be replayed on the new redirect request.
Some blobstores may reject the request in that case.
Clients may need to follow the redirect without including the OAuth token.

get.summary: Get App summary
Get detailed stats for a STARTED App
get.description: Get status for each instance of an App using the app guid.

get.summary: Get the env for an App
get.description:
Get the environment variables for an App using the app guid.
Restricted to SpaceDeveloper role.

get.summary: Get the instance information for a STARTED App
get.description:
Get status for each instance of an App using the app guid.
Note: Provided example response is for apps running on Diego.
For apps running on DEAs, instance information will appear as follows: { \"0\": { \"state\": \"RUNNING\", \"since\": 1403140717.984577, \"debug_ip\": null, \"debug_port\": null, \"console_ip\": null, \"console_port\": null } }.

put.summary: Uploads the bits for an App
put.description:
Defines and uploads the bits (artifacts and dependencies) that this application needs to run, using a multipart PUT request.
Bits that have already been uploaded can be referenced by their resource fingerprint(s).
Bits that have not already been uploaded to Cloud Foundry must be included as a zipped binary file named \"application\".
File mode bits are only presevered for applications run on a Diego backend.
If left blank, mode will default to 749, which are also the default bits for a DEA backend.
File mode bits are required to have at least the minimum permissions of 0600.

parameters.name: async
parameters.description:
If true, a new asynchronous job is submitted to persist the bits and the job id is included in the response.
      The client will need to poll the job's status until persistence is completed successfully.
      If false, the request will block until the bits are persisted synchronously.
      Defaults to false.

resources.description:
Fingerprints of the application bits that have previously been pushed to Cloud Foundry.
      Each fingerprint must include the file path, sha1 hash, and file size in bytes.
      Each fingerprint may include the file mode, which must be an octal string with at least read and write permissions for owners.
      If a mode is not provided, the default mode of 0744 will be used.
      Fingerprinted bits MUST exist in the Cloud Foundry resource cache or the request (or job, if async) will fail.

application.description: A binary zip file containing the application bits.

put.summary: Uploads the droplet for an App
put.description:
Defines and uploads a previously staged droplet that this application will run, using a multipart PUT request.
The uploaded file should be a gzipped tar file.

get.summary: Retrieving permissions on an App
get.description:
A cloud_controller.user scope is required to access this endpoint.
The user has access to sensitive data and insensitive data about the app if they are a SpaceDeveloper.
Access is denied (Forbidden: 403) for organization BillingManager and Auditor.
For all other organization and space roles with cloud_controller.user scope, access to insensitive data about the app is allowed.

delete.summary: Delete all blobs in the Buildpack cache blobstore
delete.description:
This endpoint will delete all of the existing buildpack caches in the blobstore.
The buildpack cache is used during staging by buildpacks as a way to cache certain resources, e.g.
downloaded Ruby gems.
An admin who wanted to decrease the size of their blobstore could use this endpoint to delete unnecessary blobs.

put.summary: Assign a Buildpack to a Stack
put.description:
Buildpacks can be assigned to different stacks on the system.
Only buildpacks which match the stack of the app will be utilized.
Some buildpacks specify a stack via their manifest, and this stack is automatically assigned.
It can also be manually assigned via this endpoint.
If a buildpack stack field is null, it will be handled as belonging to all stacks on the system.

name.description: The name of the buildpack. To be used by app buildpack field. (only alphanumeric characters)

stack.description: The stack the buildpack belongs to.

position.description: The order in which the buildpacks are checked during buildpack auto-detection.

enabled.description: Whether or not the buildpack will be used for staging

locked.description: Whether or not the buildpack is locked to prevent updates

filename.description: The name of the uploaded buildpack file

delete.summary: Delete a Particular Buildpack

parameters.name: async
parameters.description: Will run the delete request in a background job. Recommended: 'true'.

get.summary: Retrieve a Particular Buildpack

name.description: The name of the buildpack. To be used by app buildpack field. (only alphanumeric characters)

enabled.description: Whether or not the buildpack will be used for staging

locked.description: Whether or not the buildpack is locked to prevent updates

filename.description: The name of the uploaded buildpack file

get.summary: Retrieve a Particular Event
Get all feature flags
Get the App Bits Upload feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, space developers can upload app bits.
When disabled, only admin users can upload app bits

get.summary: Get the App Scaling feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, space developers can perform scaling operations (i.e.
change memory, disk or instances).
When disabled, only admins can perform scaling operations.

get.summary: Get the Diego Docker feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, Docker applications are supported by Diego.
When disabled, Docker applications will stop running.
It will still be possible to stop and delete them and update their configurations.

get.summary: Get the Private Domain Creation feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, an organization manager can create private domains for that organization.
When disabled, only admin users can create private domains.

get.summary: Get the Route Creation feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, a space developer can create routes in a space.
When disabled, only admin users can create routes.

get.summary: Get the Service Instance Creation feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, a space developer can create service instances in a space.
When disabled, only admin users can create service instances.

get.summary: Get the Set User Roles feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, Org Managers or Space Managers can add access roles by username.
In order for this feature to be enabled the CF operator must: 1) Enable the `/ids/users/` endpoint for UAA 2) Create a UAA `cloud_controller_username_lookup` client with the `scim.userids` authority

get.summary: Get the Space Developer Environment Variable Visibility feature flag (experimental)
get.description:
When enabled, space developers can do a get on the /v2/apps/:guid/env and /v3/apps/:guid/env end points.
When disabled, space developers can no longer do a get against these end points.

get.summary: Get the Environment Variable Visibility feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, all users can see their environment variables.
When disabled, no users can see environment variables.

get.summary: Get the Space Scoped Private Broker Creation feature flag (experimental)
get.description:
When enabled, space developers can create space scoped private brokers.
When disabled, only admin users can create create space scoped private brokers.

get.summary: Get the Task Creation feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, space developers can create tasks.
When disabled, only admin users can create tasks.

get.summary: Get the Unset User Roles feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, Org Managers or Space Managers can remove access roles by username.
In order for this feature to be enabled the CF operator must: 1) Enable the `/ids/users/` endpoint for UAA 2) Create a UAA `cloud_controller_username_lookup` client with the `scim.userids` authority

get.summary: Get the User Org Creation feature flag
get.description:
When enabled, any user can create an organization via the API.
When disabled, only admin users can create organizations via the API.

put.summary: Set a feature flag

enabled.description: The state of the feature flag.

error_message.description: The custom error message for the feature flag.

non_basic_services_allowed.description: If an organization can have services that are not free

total_services.description: How many services an organization can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

total_service_keys.description: How many service keys an organization can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

total_routes.description: How many routes an organization can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

total_reserved_route_ports.description: How many routes an organization can have that use a reserved port. These routes count toward total_routes. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

total_private_domains.description: How many private domains an organization can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

memory_limit.description: How much memory in megabyte an organization can have.

instance_memory_limit.description: The maximum amount of memory in megabyte an application instance can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

trial_db_allowed.description: If an organization can have a trial db.

app_instance_limit.description: How many app instances an organization can create. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

app_task_limit.description: The number of tasks that can be run per app. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

put.summary: List all matching resources
put.description:
This endpoint matches given resource SHA / file size pairs against the Cloud Controller cache, and reports the subset which describes already existing files.
This is usually used to avoid uploading duplicate files when pushing an app which has only been partially changed.
Cloud Foundry operators may set minimum / maximum file sizes to match against.
If the file size provided is outside this range, it will not be matched against.

path.description: The path for a route as raw text. 1) Paths must be between 2 and 128 characters 2) Paths must start with a forward slash "/" 3) Paths must not contain a "?" Note: not supported for internal routes.

name.description: The name of the security group.

rules.description:
The egress rules for apps that belong to this security group.
A rule consists of a protocol (tcp,icmp,udp,all), destination CIDR or destination range,
port or port range (tcp,udp,all), type (control signal for icmp, where -1 allows all), code (control signal for icmp, where -1 allows all),
log (enables logging for the egress rule, only valid for tcp rules), description (optional description of the rule). This field is limited to 16MB.

get.summary: List Service Usage Events
get.description:
Events are sorted by internal database IDs.
This order may differ from created_at.
Events close to the current time should not be processed because other events may still have open transactions that will change their order in the results.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Parameters used to filter the result set.Format queries as <filter><op><value> Valid ops: : >= <= < > IN Valid filters: service_instance_type, service_guid

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page of results to fetch

parameters.name: results-per-page
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: order-direction
parameters.description: Order of the results: asc (default) or desc

parameters.name: after_guid
parameters.description: Restrict results to Service Usage Events after the one with the given guid

post.summary: Purge and reseed Service Usage Events
post.description:
Destroys all existing events.
Populates new usage events, one for each existing service instance.
All populated events will have a created_at value of current time.
There is the potential race condition if service instances are currently being created or deleted.
The seeded usage events will have the same guid as the service instance.

total_services.description: How many services a space can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

total_routes.description: How many routes a space can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

total_reserved_route_ports.description: How many routes a space can have that use a reserved port. These routes count toward total_routes. (-1 represents an unlimited amount; subject to org quota)

memory_limit.description: How much memory in megabytes a space can have.

total_service_keys.description: How many service keys an organization can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

instance_memory_limit.description: The maximum amount of memory in megabytes an application instance can have. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

app_instance_limit.description: How many app instances a space can create. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

organization_guid.description: The owning organization of the space quota

app_task_limit.description: The number of tasks that can be run per app. (-1 represents an unlimited amount)

parameters.description: Parameters used to filter the result set.Format queries as <filter><op><value> Valid ops: : >= <= < > IN Valid filters: space_guid, organization_guid, managed_organization_guid, billing_managed_organization_guid, audited_organization_guid, managed_space_guid, audited_space_guid (Note that filtering on space_guid will return an empty list if you specify anything other than the guid included in the path.)

name.description: The name of the space

organization_guid.description: The guid of the associated organization

developer_guids.description: The list of the associated developers

manager_guids.description: The list of the associated managers

auditor_guids.description: The list of the associated auditors

domain_guids.description: The list of the associated domains

security_group_guids.description: The list of the associated security groups

space_quota_definition_guid.description: The guid of the associated space quota definition

allow_ssh.description: Whether or not Space Developers can enable ssh on apps in the space

isolation_segment_guid.description: The guid of the isolation segment to assign to the space.  The space's organization must be entitled for the isolation segment.
